content: #blossoms Beautiful blooming sunflowers at Shanghai Blooming Garden! : Shanghai Blooming Garden #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#hotspot Autumn magic awaits at the Shanghai Expo Culture Park! Twin Mountain: Discover Twin Mountain, a rising star southeast of the Shanghai Expo Culture Park! Hike to the summit for breathtaking views, then wander down to the charming "Magic City Huangguoshu," an artificial waterfall nestled among lush greenery. Music Forest Lawn: Relax at the revitalized Music Forest Lawn, perfectly positioned by the Eleven-Arch Bridge and Central Lake. Soak up the early winter sun as you roll on the grass, soaking in picturesque views of Twin Mountain and the peaceful lake—truly revitalizing! Shanghai Greenhouse Garden: Explore the Shanghai Greenhouse Garden, the largest glass greenhouse in Asia, showcasing diverse environments like deserts, rainforests, and canyons. Don’t miss the awe-inspiring 800-year-old olive tree and the nation’s largest baobab tree! World Flower Garden: Next to the Greenhouse Garden lies the serene World Flower Garden, a hidden oasis featuring stunning global garden designs. Be sure not to overlook this beautiful spot! #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

The 240-hour transit visa-free policy is a game-changer! Learn if you qualify and how to maximize your 10 days exploring multiple Chinese cities. : China Daily #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #ChinaTravel #VisaFree #ExploreTheWorld #TravelNews #240HourVisaFree
#blooms Oriental Pearl TV Tower and Cherry Blossoms at Night : Huaci #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#ShanghaiNewYearMagic #chinesenewyear A must-try delicacy this festive season in Fengxian, Shanghai is the delightful "Lao Ba Yang"! The phrase "eight" symbolizes good fortune and completeness, encompassing a sumptuous spread of 15 dishes typically categorized as "one bowl, eight dishes, four stews, and two dim sum." The centerpiece bowl features eight different meat dishes including sweet and sour spare ribs and white-cut chicken, artfully arranged in a circle to symbolize joy and togetherness. The New Year's Eve dinner wouldn’t be complete without star dishes like salted pork and egg rolls, each prepared to perfection! The variety continues with sweet and savory soups followed by delightful snacks like eight-treasure rice and wontons to end the meal on a sweet note. #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #springfestival #chinesenewyear2025 #CNY #ExploreShanghai
#tourguide Romance at the BFC (The Bund Finance Center) #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#tourguide Experience the breathtaking beauty of Guilin Park, where nature itself is an artist! This picturesque spot features simple yet elegant wooden tea tables, intricate wood carvings, and stunning twisted branches of vibrant maple trees, all ablaze in shades of red, orange, and gold. It’s like stepping into a living painting! : Rionida #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

A game-changing update from the National Immigration Administration! As of December 17, the transit visa exemption policy has been fully revamped, allowing foreigners from 54 eligible countries, including Russia, Brazil, the UK, the US, and Canada, to enjoy a remarkable 10-day visa-free stay in China. With new ports added, travel just became easier and more accessible! #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #ChinaTravel

#tourguide Hop on a double-decker sightseeing bus in #Shanghai and witness the city's beauty from a new perspective! With two routes covering key landmarks and easy transfers, you can explore Shanghai's iconic spots at your own pace. Start your sightseeing adventure today!

Stroll down Yongkang Road, a 500-meter-long treasure trove of specialty shops where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with sweet ice cream! This bustling lane is perfect for a laid-back weekend, where vintage fashion shops, and cozy tea houses create a harmonious blend.

#restaurants The Shanghai Peace Hotel is famous at home and abroad for carrying the history and legends of Old Shanghai. Since 1980, presidents and celebrities from all over the world have come here to watch the concerts put on by these musicians whose average age is around 75.

#hotspot The heights of excitement soar as the 52nd-floor terrace of Global Harbor opens its doors to the public! Dubbed "Top of the World, Wandering in the Clouds," this lofty viewpoint offers sweeping panoramas of the skyline at an awe-inspiring altitude of 258 meters! Explore the delightful mix of shopping options from luxury brands to trendy boutiques, all while soaking up the stunning views from this breathtaking new destination in Putuo District! Global Harbor, Putuo District #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

Exciting news for travelers! The visa-free transit policy for citizens from 54 countries has been extended to 240 hours. Check if your country is included and start planning your Shanghai adventure! Need Cash in Shanghai? Here’s How to Exchange Currency! While most payments in China are digital, having some yuan on hand can come in handy! Where to exchange money? Airports – 13 exchange counters at Pudong & Hongqiao Banks – 3,000+ branches across Shanghai What you need: Passport + foreign currency How it works: Find a counter, make the exchange, and you’re good to go! Stay tuned for EP3: A Traveler’s Guide to Currency Exchange in Shanghai for all the details! : CityNewsService #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #ShanghaiTips #ShanghaiTravel #TravelSmart #CurrencyExchange #PayLikeALocal

#festival Dragon boat racing meets global vibes on Suzhou Creek! The 21st Shanghai Suzhou Creek Dragon Boat Invitational Tournament was a total splash—1,078 paddlers, 58 teams, and 12 international crews from the Netherlands, Australia, Malaysia, and more! Even expat journalists jumped in as the “Foreign Press Team,” getting a real taste of Duanwu Festival spirit. Rewatch the action and feel the energy! : City News Service #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #DragonBoatFestival

Celebrate Chinese New Year with a feast at Haocailou and savor the exquisite Shunde cuisine amidst a bustling ambiance. Don't miss the adorable lion baozi and mouthwatering dishes like Shunde stir-fried chicken, braised eel with rice, braised meat, and steamed dace meatloaf!

#tourguide Sijing Ancient Town is the core area of the Songjiang Xiatang Historical and Cultural District, with a total land area of 15.52 hectares. In 2005, it was named the Shanghai Historical and Cultural District. #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

This red and white English country house tucked away in the trees is a lovely example of #Shanghai’s unique and varied architectures. Its red tile roof is steep and double-sloped, the red brick chimney is tall, and its half-exposed wooden frame is full of English charm!

Visit the ancient ginkgo in Jiading Ancient Tree Park, which has graced the park with its beauty for an astonishing 1,200 years. An awe-inspiring testament to nature's enduring resilience and elegance. Address: No. 230, Taihai Road, Guangming Village, Anting Town : An"

#hotspot Tucked away on Huangpu District’s Zhizaoju Road, MIXPACE Mandela presents an extraordinary juxtaposition of the old and the futuristic. At first glance, it appears to be just another old building, but step inside to discover a surreal, dreamlike shared office space created from a former rivet factory. Block C, No. 23, Lane 833, Zhizaoju Road, Huangpu District, Shanghai : Jasondehoujianzhushishidai #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#restaurants Looking for your next unique dining experience? We’ve complied some of Huangpu District’s best picks for you! 18 by FRÉDÉRIC ANTON 3rd Floor, Bund 18 Jiu Chu Tang East side of the third floor, No. 5, The Bund, Zhongshan East 1st Road #meetinshanghai

Join us in the captivating world of Yue Opera in this episode featuring rising star Ma Jiaxin and the seasoned Fan Yajuan, head of the Shanghai Xuhui Yue Opera Troupe. #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #MyFavoriteChineseTreasures #MyFavoriteShanghaiSeason4 #shortvideoshowcase #vlog

The ODE TO SPRING Special #Exhibition Celebrating the Year of the Rabbit is now open! #Shanghai Museum has selected 5 museum outstanding cultural relics from their collection, and borrowed 2 from Shanxi Museum and Quzhou Museum to curate this amazing Chinese New Year exhibition.

#Exhibition Shanghai New Exhibition is here! Painting Unsettled Exhibition period: March 11th-May 21st Venue: UCCA Edge (88 Xizang North Road, Jing'an District) #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#CSIAF The Med Festival Of The 22nd China Shanghai International Arts Festival, 2023 Nanxun International Children Arts Festival, has officially kicked off in Nanxun Ancient Town, Huzhou, Zhejiang. Join us from October 28th to November 12th and lose yourself in the magic of art!

#ShanghaiTourismFestival Prepare for a romantic journey as the Shanghai Tourism Festival presents the Rose Wedding, an elegant affair featuring 18 couples and a series of enchanting activities set against the backdrop of cultural and tourism landmarks. #meetinshanghai

#hotspot Embrace spring with new campsites in Songjiang! Gather your friends and embark on a spring adventure to the new camping sites at Shanghai Film and Television Park, Cloud Granary and Guangfulin Relic Cultural Park in Songjiang. #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#market Experience the magic of the RockBund New Year Market on Yuanmingyuan Road Pedestrian Street! Here, tradition meets modernity in a dazzling display of culture and commerce, showcasing over 50 independent brand stalls filled with century-old brands, trendy fashion, traditional delicacies, and creative crafts. Enjoy free admission and bring your furry friends along! Plus, don’t miss the daily live performances—ranging from open-air films to vibrant folk art shows—that will keep you entertained as you soak in the New Year’s spirit! #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #springfestival #chinesenewyear2025 #CNY

#tourguide Horseback adventures in #Shanghai! Aijiu Equestrian Club Address: No.999, Jibang Road, Chongming District : No. 799, Lanhai Road, Chongming District Dongping National Forest Park : No. 2188, Beiyan Road, Chongming District #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai

In just a second, the computing power of the "Siyuan No. 1" computer cluster generates impossible calculations. Every 45 seconds, a car rolls off the assembly line at #Shanghai Tesla Gigafactory. In 60 seconds, Pudong New Area's foreign trade reaches millions. : Pudongfabu

#Exhibition Don't miss " MIRRORING：Lucio Fontana与Michelangelo Pistoletto" at Prada Rong Zhai Shanghai. This exhibition showcases the captivating works of two Italian art titans, exploring space, reflection, and viewer interaction. No. 186, Shaanxi North Road, Jing'an District : Sisu #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#drinks Indulge in the simplicity and beauty of tea with hot milk at the hidden gem, Kurkur, tucked away in a quaint Shanghai alley. Enjoy a warm beverage with a smiley face! : Bonjour_doona #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

My Favorite Shanghai EP47｜Li Siqi: Shanghai - My Dearest Hometown Join Li Siqi as she explores the deep connection between Shanghai and Jewish refugees in this heartfelt episode. This journey uncovers a significant piece of history that resonates with both Jews and Shanghainese.

The How Art #Museum in Shanghai's Zhangjiang, Pudong district is hosting three exciting #exhibitions that you shouldn't miss: - Wu Ziyang Solo Exhibition: Cloud-Native Nomadic - Friedrich Einhoff: Return To Self - Martin Wehmer: RE-COLORED No. 1, Lane 2277, Zuchong Road

#DiscoverShanghai Experience the charm of Shanghai's historical past at the "Shanghai Morning" Hall. Located in the China Securities Museum on the North Bund, this stunning reading room takes you back in time with its antique wooden bookshelves and cozy armrest chairs.

#ShanghaiTourismFestival The Moon Rising over the Sea- Event time: September 29 - October 6 Activity: Mid-Autumn Festival and National Day Parent-child Garden Party Event location: Jinshan City Beach #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai #festival

#HackTheMenu Get into the festive spirit with Shanghai's exclusive Christmas treats now available online! Indulge in a Christmas tree cake oozing with matcha cream and bursting with juicy strawberry bits! Nonoooo #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai #Shanghai

#festival What’s not to love about Chinese culture? Come to #Shanghai and experience the Chinese New Year through these fun activities! : Shanghai Yu Garden : Guyi Garden : Nanxiang Old Street : Fengjing Ancient Town : Pier No. 3, Shiliupu #meetinshanghai #CNY

#food Chinese New Year’s Sweet Treats! KUMO KUMO’s Chinese New Year’s cakes come with two huge festive rabbit ears and are covered in fresh coconut! Address: B1, Meiluo City, No. 1111, Zhaojiabang Road, Xuhui District (multiple chain stores) : Songbinjintianqunale #CNY

#tourguide The Spring Festival is almost here! Check out these artistic exhibitions to bring in the New Year! "Next Cultural Producer" Season 1 "Art Of Craft" Excellent installations of woodcarving, painting, sculpture, and more at the Power Station of Art! #meetinshanghai

Experience the best of Shanghai's cold noodle scene at Si Ru Chun! For 90 years, Si Ru Chun has been a beloved restaurant, serving locals with its affordable prices and excellent cold noodles. Enjoy the smooth and chewy noodles paired with rich and mellow peanut sauce.

#Exhibition Sun Ke Villa welcomes the first Chinese solo exhibition of Italian artist and illustrator Emiliano Ponzi. See more than 60 unique works and architectural spaces. :until March 5th (closed on Mondays) : Sun Ke Villa, Columbia Circle #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai

Immerse yourself in the enchanting melodies of the Shanghai Chinese Orchestra at #CSIAF. "The Sound Of Oriental Wisdom" takes you on a unique musical journey set against a 360-degree immersive backdrop. Life and nature come alive through captivating Shanghai-style folk music.

#coffees The sunlit LOAM Cafe is an ideal spot to enjoy your next cup of coffee! It’s pet-friendly and a favorite spot for cycling enthusiasts who can park their bikes on mounts in the shop! Address: No. 2596, Longteng Avenue : Mogudajiang #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai

#Museum Cheng Art Museum is located in the 210,000-square-meter Elite Valley. It took 8 years to transform this old warehouse, and its building itself is a work of art. Cheng Art Museum (Pusu Art) : No. 258, Changjiang Road, Baoshan District #meetinshanghai #AllInShanghai
